description: Leech triangle: k-th number (0<=k<=n) in n-th row (0<=n) is number of octads in S(5,8,24) containing k given points and missing n-k given points.
references: F. J. MacWilliams and N. J. A. Sloane, The Theory of Error-Correcting Codes, Elsevier-North Holland, 1978, p. 68.
J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 278.
CRC Handbook of Combinatorial Designs, 1996, p. 69.
links: Index entries for sequences related to Steiner systems
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
